member.name: T:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Grid.ColumnSizerBase`1
member.summary: Represents a class that provides the base implementation to calculate column widths based on different column sizer options for SfDataGrid() and SfTreeGrid().

member.name: M:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Grid.ColumnSizerBase`1.ResetAutoCalculation(Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Grid.GridColumnBase)
member.summary: Resets the auto width for the specified column.
member.param: The corresponding column to reset the auto width.
member.remarks: The column width is reset to double.Nan ,if the column sizing is need to recalculate based on the data.
member.exception: Thrown when the column is null.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Grid.ColumnSizerBase`1.SetAutoWidth(Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Grid.GridColumnBase,System.Double)
member.summary: Sets the width for the specified column based on column sizer.
member.param: The corresponding column to set Auto width.
The corresponding width set as Auto width.
member.exception: Thrown when the column is null.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Grid.ColumnSizerBase`1.ResetAutoCalculations
member.summary: Resets Auto width calculation for all the columns.
member.remarks: The column width is reset to double.Nan for all columns ,if the column sizing is need to recalculate based on the data.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Grid.ColumnSizerBase`1.ResetAutoCalculationforAllColumns
member.summary: Resets Auto width calculation for all the columns.
member.remarks: The column width is reset to double.Nan for all columns ,if the column sizing is need to recalculate based on the data.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Grid.ColumnSizerBase`1.AutoFitMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates the mode for calculating the width of the cell based on cell content. calculates the column width in optimized way.
member.value: One of the enumeration that specifies the way to measure the width of the corresponding column. The default value is .

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Grid.ColumnSizerBase`1.SortIconWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the width of sort icon for column sizing calculation..
member.value: The width of the sort icon. The default value is 25.
member.remarks: The and type of column sizer calculates the column width based on static sort icon width. When the sort icon width is customized, that is need to be initialized to this property for customizing column sizer calculation based on new sort icon width.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Grid.ColumnSizerBase`1.FontSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the font size to compute the column width.
member.value: The size of the font. The default value is 12.
member.remarks: By default the column width calculation based on fixed font size. When the font size is customized, that is need to be initialized to this property for customizing column sizer calculation based on new font size.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Grid.ColumnSizerBase`1.FontFamily
member.summary: Gets or sets the FontFamily to compute the column width.
member.value: The FontFamily to compute the column width. The default value is Segoe UI.
member.remarks: By default the column width calculation based on fixed font family. When the font family is customized, that is need to be initialized to this property for customizing column sizer calculation based on new font family.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Grid.ColumnSizerBase`1.FontStretch
member.summary: Gets or sets the FontStretch to compute the column width.
member.value: The FontStretch to compute the column width.
member.remarks: By default the column width calculation based on fixed FontStretch. When the FontStretch is customized, that is need to be initialized to this property for customizing column sizer calculation based on new FontStretch.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Grid.ColumnSizerBase`1.FontWeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the FontWeight to compute the column width.
member.value: The FontWeight to compute the column width.
member.remarks: By default the column width calculation based on fixed FontWeight. When the FontWeight is customized, that is need to be initialized to this property for customizing column sizer calculation based on new FontWeight.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Grid.ColumnSizerBase`1.Margin
member.summary: Gets or sets the margin to compute the column width.
member.value: The margin to compute the column width.
member.remarks: By default the column width calculation based on fixed margin. When the margin is customized, that is need to be initialized to this property for customizing column sizer calculation based on new margin.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Grid.ColumnSizerBase`1.AllowMeasureTextByFormattedText
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the column width is measured based on formatted text.
member.value: true if the column width is calculated based on the formatted text; otherwise, false.

member.remarks: Setting AutoGenerateColumnsForCustomType to true, generate columns for inner properties.For example, OrderInfo class has Customer property of type Customer, then column generated like Customer.CustomerID.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Grid.MergedCellManager
member.summary: Class that handles the cell merging in SfDataGrid.

members.member: Initialize the merged row. 1. IsSpannedRow. 2. IsSpannedColumn. 3. Get's merging range. 4. Added to CoeveredCell's collection based on range avialable in DataGrid. Update the merged row. 1. Reset IsSpannedRow. 2. Reset IsSpannedColumn 3. Reset range. 4. Remove Range. 5. Update mapped row column index of covered cells based on visible row and column.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Grid.GroupColumnDescription.SortGroupRecords
member.summary: Gets or sets the value that indicates whether to sort the inner records of group while using custom grouping.
member.value: The default value is false.
member.remarks: By default, grouped columns records are not sorted as the values of all the records in one group will be same. So, only groups will be sorted based on group key. In custom grouping cases, grouped columns records value may differ. So in this case, you can sort the records of group by setting SortGroupRecords property to true.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Grid.Cells.GridVirtualizingCellRenderer`2
member.summary:
GridVirtualizingCellRenderer is an abstract base class for cell renderers that need live UIElement visuals displayed in a cell. You can derive from this class and provide the type of the UIElement you want to show inside cells as type parameter. The class provides strong typed virtual methods for initializing content of the cell and arranging the cell visuals. See
GridVirtualizingCellRendererBase{T}
for more details.
The idea behind this class is to provide a place where we can add general code that should be shared for all cell renderers in the tree derived from GridVirtualizingCellRendererBase. While this class does at the moment not add meaningful functionality to GridVirtualizingCellRendererBase we created this extra layer of inheritance to make it easy to share code for the GridVirtualizingCellRendererBase base class between grid and common assemblies and keep grid control specific code out of the base class. It is currently not possible with C# to the base class as template type parameter.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Grid.Cells.GridVirtualizingCellRendererBase`2
member.summary:
VirtualizingCellRendererBase is an abstract base class for cell renderers that need live UIElement visuals displayed in a cell. You can derive from this class and provide the type of the UIElement you want to show inside cells as type parameter. The class provides strong typed virtual methods for initializing content of the cell and arranging the cell visuals.
The class manages the creation of cells UIElement objects when the cell is scrolled into view and also unloading of the elements. The class offers an optimization in which elements can be recycled when is set. In this case when a cell is scrolled out of view it is moved into a recycle bin and the next time a new element is scrolled into view the element is recovered from the recycle bin and reinitialized with the new content of the cell.
when the user moves the mouse over the cell or if the UIElement is needed for other reasons.
After a UIElement was created the virtual methods and are called to wire any event listeners.
Updates to appearance and content of child elements, creation and unloading of elements will not trigger ArrangeOverride or Render calls in parent canvas.
member.typeparam: The type of the UIElement that should be placed inside cells in display mode.
The type of the UIElement that should be placed inside cells in edit mode.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Grid.Cells.GridCellRendererBase
member.summary:
Represents a class that provides default implementation of the interface for a cell renderer. You should derive from this class to implement custom cell renderer classes. There is however no dependency on GridCellRendererBase inside of the control.
If you want to implement a renderer with support for live UIElements inside the cell you should derive from the or grid adapted GridVirtualizingCellRendererBase classes.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Grid.Cells.GridCellComboBoxRenderer.ShouldGridTryToHandleKeyDown(System.Windows.Input.KeyEventArgs)
member.summary: Let Renderer decide whether the parent grid should be allowed to handle keys and prevent the key event from being handled by the visual UIElement for this renderer. If this method returns true the parent grid will handle arrow keys and set the Handled flag in the event data. Keys that the grid does not handle will be ignored and be routed to the UIElement for this renderer.
member.param: A object.

member.summary: This is a base class for Disposable. It implements the IDisposable interface as suggested in the .NET documentation using the Disposable pattern but it does not implement a finalizer. If you need finalization you need to derive from Disposable or add a finalizer to your derived class and manually call Dispose from the Finalizer.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Grid.Cells.GridUnBoundRowCellTemplateRenderer
member.summary: Class taht deals with UnboundRow template cell

member.name: T:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Grid.Cells.GridUnBoundRowCellRenderer`2
member.summary:
GridVirtualizingUnBoundRowCellRenderer is an abstract base class for UnBoundRow cell renderers that need live UIElement visuals displayed in a cell. You can derive from this class and provide the type of the UIElement you want to show inside cells as type parameter. The class provides strong typed virtual methods for initializing content of the cell and arranging the cell visuals. See
GridVirtualizingCellRendererBase{T}
for more details.
The idea behind this class is to provide a place where we can add general code that should be shared for all cell renderers in the tree derived from GridVirtualizingCellRendererBase. While this class does at the moment not add meaningful functionality to GridVirtualizingCellRendererBase we created this extra layer of inheritance to make it easy to share code for the GridVirtualizingCellRendererBase base class between grid and common assemblies and keep grid control specific code out of the base class. It is currently not possible with C# to the base class as template type parameter.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Grid.Cells.VirtualizingCellUIElementBin`1
member.summary: Represents a class that implements a cache of UIElement of the given type parameter T. It is used by the GridVirtualizingCellRendererBase renderer to recycle UIElement for cells that were scrolled out of view and delay unloading of UIElements. This reduces the number of times the UIElement needs to be created or unloaded , instead only the contents of the UIElement will be reinitialized with cell contents.
member.typeparam: Type of the UIElement to be recycled

member.name: T:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.ScrollAxis.DistanceCounterCollection
member.summary:
A collection of entities for which distances need to be counted. The collection provides methods for mapping from a distance position to an entity and vice versa.
For example, in a scrollable grid control you have rows with different heights. Use this collection to determine the total height for all rows in the grid, quickly detemine the row index for a given point and also quickly determine the point at which a row is displayed. This also allows a mapping between the scrollbars value and the rows or columns associated with that value.
member.remarks:
DistanceCounterCollection uses a high-water mark technique for allocating objects up to the modified entry with the highest index. When you modify the size of an entry the collection ensures that that objects are allocated for all entries up to the given index. Entries that are after the modified entry are assumed to have the DefaultSize and will not be allocated.
The best-case scenario is when all lines have the same DefaultSize. In such case the internal collection remains completely empty and will not cause any overhead. This makes DistanceCounterCollection also an attractive solution for the scenario where all entries have the same size (e.g. a databound grid where all rows have same height).

member.name: T:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.ScrollAxis.IDistanceCounterCollection
member.summary:
A collection of entities for which distances need to counted. The collection provides methods for mapping from a distance position to an entity and vice versa.
For example, in a scrollable grid control you have rows with different heights. Use this collection to determine the total height for all rows in the grid, quickly detemine the row index for a given point and also quickly determine the point at which a row is displayed. This also allows a mapping between the scrollbars value and the rows or columns associated with that value.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.ScrollAxis.DistanceCounterSubset
member.summary:
A collection of entities that is shared with a parent collection for which distances need to counted. The collection only is a subset for a specific range in the parent distance collection.
When you change the size of an element in this collection the change will also be reflected in the parent collection and vice versa.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.ScrollAxis.DistanceRangeCounterCollection
member.summary:
A collection of entities for which distances need to be counted. The collection provides methods for mapping from a distance position to an entity and vice versa.
For example, in a scrollable grid control you have rows with different heights. Use this collection to determine the total height for all rows in the grid, quickly detemine the row index for a given point and also quickly determine the point at which a row is displayed. This also allows a mapping between the scrollbars value and the rows or columns associated with that value.
member.remarks:
DistanceCounterCollection internally uses ranges for allocating objects up to the modified entry with the highest index. When you modify the size of an entry the collection ensures that that objects are allocated for all entries up to the given index. Entries that are after the modified entry are assumed to have the DefaultSize and will not be allocated.
Ranges will only be allocated for those lines that have different sizes. If you do for example only change the size of line 100 to be 10 then the collection will internally create two ranges: Range 1 from 0-99 with DefaultSize and Range 2 from 100-100 with size 10. This approach makes this collection work very efficient with grid scenarios where often many rows have the same height.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.ScrollAxis.LineScrollAxis
member.summary:
The LineScrollAxis implements scrolling only for whole lines. You can hide lines and LineScrollAxis provides a mapping mechanism between the index of the line and the scroll index and vice versa. Hidden lines are not be counted when the scroll index is determined for a line.
The LineScrollAxis does not support scrolling in between lines (pixel scrolling). This can be of advantage if you have a large number of lines with varying line sizes. In such case the LineScrollAxis does not need to maintain a collection that tracks line sizes whereas the does need to.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.ScrollAxis.ScrollAxisBase
member.summary:
ScrollAxisBase is an abstract base class and implements scrolling logic for both horizontal and vertical scrolling in a . Logical units in the ScrollAxisBase are called "Lines". With the a line representes rows in a grid and with a line represents columns in a grid.
ScrollAxisBase has support for frozen header and footer lines, maintaining a scroll position and updating and listening to scrollbars. It also maintains a collection of items for all the lines that are visible in the viewing area. ScrollAxisBase wires itself with a and reacts to changes in line count, line sizes, hidden state and default line size.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.ScrollAxis.PixelScrollAxis
member.summary:
PixelScrollAxis implements scrolling logic for both horizontal and vertical scrolling in a . Logical units in the ScrollAxisBase are called "Lines". With the a line representes rows in a grid and with a line represents columns in a grid.
PixelScrollAxis supports pixel scrolling and calculates the total height or width of all lines.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.ScrollAxis.SortedRangeValueList`1
member.summary: A sorted list with ordered by the start index of the ranges. SortedRangeValueList ensures that ranges of the elements inside the list do not overlap and it also ensures that there are no empty gaps meaning that the subsequent range will always have the Start position be set to the End position of the previous range plus one.

The count.

member.summary: Removes a range at the specified index. When necessary ranges are merged when preceeding and subsquent ranges have the same value.
member.param: The index for the range to be removed.
The count.
Allocate this object before a Remove call when moving ranges and pass it to a subsequent Insert call. Otherwise specify null.

member.summary: Sets the value for a range at the specified index. When necessary ranges are split or merged to make sure integrity of the list is maintained. (SortedRangeValueList ensures that ranges of the elements inside the list do not overlap and it also ensures that there are no empty gaps meaning that the subsequent range will always have the Start position be set to the End position of the previous range plus one.)

The count.
The value.

member.summary: Pop-up positions ( Horizontal and Vertical offsets) are calculated based on Pop-up height and width.
member.remarks: calculate the pop-up position based on the height of the window and the location of the control in window. if AutoPopupSize is enabled, then PopupVerticalOffset is calculated based on remaining height of the editor in both top and bottom.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Grid.SfMultiColumnDropDownControl.PopupHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the height of pop-up.
member.value: The height of the pop-up. The is set as the default height of the pop-up.
member.remarks: When is true, the given pop-up height won't considered. Pop-up height will be calculated based on number of rows in a pop-up. When is false, then the given Pop-up height will be considered. if the given pop-up height is greater than the available height, then the pop-up height will set based on the available maximum height by considering top and bottom side of the window. if the given pop-up height is less than the PopupMinHeight, then will set as Pop-up height by not considering .

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Grid.SfMultiColumnDropDownControl.PopupWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the width of the pop-up.
member.value: The width of the pop-up. The is set as the default width of the pop-up.
member.remarks: When is true, the given Pop-up Width won't considered. Pop-up width will be calculated based on the number of columns in a SfDataGrid. When is false, then the given Pop-up width will be considered. if the given pop-up width is greater than the available width, then the pop-up width will be set based on the available maximum width by considering left and right side of the window. if the given pop-up width is less than the PopupMinWidth, then will set as Pop-up Width by not considering .

member.summary: The size is a weighted proportion of available space.

member.summary: The size is based on the contents of both the cells and the column header.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.TreeGrid.TreeColumnSizer.AutoFillColumn
member.summary: The size is based on the contents of both the cells and the column header with last column auto fill. The column to be filled can be any column.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.TreeGrid.TreeColumnSizer.SizeToCells
member.summary: The size is based on the contents of the cells.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.TreeGrid.TreeColumnSizer.SizeToHeader
member.summary: The size is based on the contents of the column header.

member.summary: The body region of the SfTreeGrid.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.TreeGrid.TreeGridOperation
member.summary: Defines the constants that specify the possible grid operations in SfTreeGrid.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.TreeGrid.TreeGridOperation.Sorting
member.summary: Specifies the column is being sorted in SfTreeGrid.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.TreeGrid.TreeGridOperation.RowHeaderChanged
member.summary: The RowHeader state is being changed in SfTreeGrid.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.TreeGrid.FilterLevel
member.summary: Defines the constants that specify how nodes should be filtered in SfTreeGrid.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.TreeGrid.FilterLevel.Root
member.summary: Filtering will be applied only in root nodes.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.TreeGrid.FilterLevel.All
member.summary: Filtering will be applied on root nodes, if root nodes matches filter criteria, it will get displayed in View. If root node passes in filter criteria, then child nodes will be filtered and so on.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.TreeGrid.FilterLevel.Extended
member.summary: If a node matches the filter condition, all its parent nodes are also displayed, even though parent node not matches the filter condition.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.TreeGrid.TreeGridCollectionChangedReason
member.summary: Defines the constants that specify the possible reasons for collection changes in SfTreeGrid.

member.summary: Specifies the node collection change.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.TreeGrid.TreeGridCollectionChangedReason.SourceCollectionChanged
member.summary: Specifies the source collection change.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.TreeGrid.TreeGridCollectionChangedReason.SelectedItemsCollection
member.summary: Specifies the SelectedItems collection change.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.TreeGrid.TreeGridCollectionChangedReason.ColumnsCollection
member.summary: Specifies the columns collection change.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.TreeGrid.NodeOperation
member.summary: Defines the constants that specify whether nodes are expanded/collapsed in SfTreeGrid.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.TreeGrid.NodeOperation.NodesExpanded
member.summary: Specifies all nodes are expanded

member.name: F:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.TreeGrid.NodeOperation.NodesCollapsed

member.name: T:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.TreeGrid.TreeViewRefreshMode
member.summary: Defines the constants that specify how view should be refreshed while calling BeginInit, EndInit and Defer refresh method.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.TreeGrid.TreeViewRefreshMode.DeferRefresh
member.summary: Specifies that nodes will be recreated.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.TreeGrid.TreeViewRefreshMode.NodeRefresh
member.summary: Specifies that nodes will be rearranged based on sorting order.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.TreeGrid.SelfRelationUpdateMode
member.summary: Defines the constants that specify how nodes should be arranged while changing ChildPropertyName and ParentPropertyName in Self Relational mode.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.TreeGrid.SelfRelationUpdateMode.None
member.summary: Denotes nodes are not rearranged based on ChildProperty when child property gets changed while editing and property change.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.TreeGrid.SelfRelationUpdateMode.MoveOnEdit
member.summary: Denotes whether to move the node based on ChildProperty when child property gets changed while editing.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.TreeGrid.SelfRelationUpdateMode.MoveAndExpandOnEdit
member.summary: Denotes whether to expand the parent nodes (if not expanded) when node is moved from another parent due to change of ChildProperty in editing. It is applicable for ChildPropertyChange only

member.name: F:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.TreeGrid.SelfRelationUpdateMode.MoveOnPropertyChange
member.summary: Denotes whether to move the node based on ChildProperty when child property gets changed on property change.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.TreeGrid.SelfRelationUpdateMode.ScrollToUpdatedItem
member.summary: ScrollToUpdatedItem is applicable for MoveAndExpandOnEdit only.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.TreeGrid.DropPosition
member.summary: Defines the constants which specify the drop position in row while drag and drop nodes in SfTreeGrid.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.TreeGrid.DropPosition.None
member.summary: Specifies the node can not be dropped at this position.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.TreeGrid.DropPosition.DropAbove
member.summary: Specifies the dragging node will be dropped above the current row in TreeGrid.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.TreeGrid.DropPosition.DropBelow
member.summary: Specifies the dragging node will be dropped below the current row in TreeGrid.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.TreeGrid.DropPosition.DropAsChild
member.summary: Specifies the dragging node will be dropped as a child node of the current node in TreeGrid.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.TreeGrid.DropPosition.Default
member.summary: Specifies the dragging node will be dropped outside of the TreeGrid.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.TreeGrid.RowIndentMode
member.summary: Defines the constants which specify the selection and background indentation in row, when first column is expander column.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.TreeGrid.RowIndentMode.Default
member.summary: Specifies that the selection and row background will be appeared on the entire row.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.TreeGrid.RowIndentMode.Level
member.summary: Specifies that the selection and row background will be appeared after expander when first column is expander column.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.TreeGrid.CheckBoxSelectionMode
member.summary: Defines the constants which specify how selection should be processed when ShowCheckBox is true in SfTreeGrid.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.TreeGrid.CheckBoxSelectionMode.Default
member.summary: Specifies that checking/unchecking the checkbox should not affect the selection.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.TreeGrid.CheckBoxSelectionMode.SelectOnCheck
member.summary: Specifies that user can select/unselect only by checking/unchecking the checkbox. Row can not be selected by using pointer operation. Key navigation, Editing and programmatic selection will not be supported.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.TreeGrid.CheckBoxSelectionMode.SynchronizeSelection
member.summary: Specifies that user can select by checking checkbox and also selecting/unselecting the row will check/uncheck the checkbox.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.TreeGrid.RecursiveCheckingMode
member.summary: Defines the constants which specify in which case recursive checking should be applied when is True.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.TreeGrid.RecursiveCheckingMode.Default
member.summary: Specifies that recursive checking will be applied while checking CheckBox and also changing CheckBoxMappingName.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.TreeGrid.RecursiveCheckingMode.OnCheck
member.summary: Specifies that recursive checking will be applied only while checking CheckBox and it will not be applied if CheckBoxMappingName is changed.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.TreeGrid.Cells.TreeGridVirtualizingCellRenderer`2
member.summary:
TreeGridVirtualizingCellRenderer is an abstract base class for cell renderers that need live UIElement visuals displayed in a cell. You can derive from this class and provide the type of the UIElement you want to show inside cells as type parameter. The class provides strong typed virtual methods for initializing content of the cell and arranging the cell visuals. See
TreeGridVirtualizingCellRendererBase{T}
for more details.
The idea behind this class is to provide a place where we can add general code that should be shared for all cell renderers in the tree derived from TreeGridVirtualizingCellRendererBase. While this class does at the moment not add meaningful functionality to TreeGridVirtualizingCellRendererBase we created this extra layer of inheritance to make it easy to share code for the TreeGridVirtualizingCellRendererBase base class between grid and common assemblies and keep grid control specific code out of the base class. It is currently not possible with C# to the base class as template type parameter.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.TreeGrid.Cells.TreeGridVirtualizingCellRendererBase`2
member.summary:
TreeGridVirtualizingCellRendererBase is an abstract base class for cell renderers that need live UIElement visuals displayed in a cell. You can derive from this class and provide the type of the UIElement you want to show inside cells as type parameter. The class provides strong typed virtual methods for initializing content of the cell and arranging the cell visuals.
The class manages the creation of cells UIElement objects when the cell is scrolled into view and also unloading of the elements. The class offers an optimization in which elements can be recycled when is set. In this case when a cell is scrolled out of view it is moved into a recycle bin and the next time a new element is scrolled into view the element is recovered from the recycle bin and reinitialized with the new content of the cell.
when the user moves the mouse over the cell or if the UIElement is needed for other reasons.
After a UIElement was created the virtual methods and are called to wire any event listeners.
Updates to appearance and content of child elements, creation and unloading of elements will not trigger ArrangeOverride or Render calls in parent canvas.
member.typeparam: The type of the UIElement that should be placed inside cells in display mode.
The type of the UIElement that should be placed inside cells in edit mode.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.TreeGrid.Cells.TreeGridCellRendererBase
member.summary:
Represents a class that provides default implementation of the interface for a cell renderer. You should derive from this class to implement custom cell renderer classes. There is however no dependency on GridCellRendererBase inside of the control.
If you want to implement a renderer with support for live UIElements inside the cell you should derive from the or grid adapted GridVirtualizingCellRendererBase classes.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether elements can be recycled when scrolled out of view.
member.value: true if elements can be recycled when scrolled out of view; otherwise, false. The default value is false.
member.remarks: The elements moved into a recycle bin when a cell is scrolled out of view and the next time a new element is scrolled into view the element is recovered from the recycle bin and reinitialized with the new content of the cell.

member.summary: Let Renderer decide whether the parent grid should be allowed to handle keys and prevent the key event from being handled by the visual UIElement for this renderer. If this method returns true the parent grid will handle arrow keys and set the Handled flag in the event data. Keys that the grid does not handle will be ignored and be routed to the UIElement for this renderer.

member.returns: True if the parent grid should be allowed to handle keys; false otherwise.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.TreeGrid.Cells.VirtualizingCellUIElementBin`1
member.summary: Represents a class that implements a cache of UIElement of the given type parameter T. It is used by the TreeGridVirtualizingCellRendererBase renderer to recycle UIElement for cells that were scrolled out of view and delay unloading of UIElements. This reduces the number of times the UIElement needs to be created or unloaded , instead only the contents of the UIElement will be reinitialized with cell contents.
member.typeparam: Type of the UIElement to be recycled
